messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Comfort in Nursing
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/9/2007 12:45:53 A.M. Eastern Standard Time, unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com writes: Simply  pulling up my shirt and touching is
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/9/2007 12:45:53 A.M. Eastern Standard Time,
unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com writes:

Simply pulling up my shirt and touching is something they like to do, too.
And I just tell them whether it's okay for me at the moment, or not.<<<<<<<<

I have boys. My youngest, when he was like 8, right after he stopped
nursing, liked to have his hand against my breast to fall asleep. Now he likes to
lay his head against my shirt at the side of my breast. He says it is soft
and warm. It comforts him. That is fine with me. I can see it changing, in
that he does this less and less. Soon it will be not at all.

Pam G






[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
